titleInfo.title: Perique Tobacco Oral History Project
titleInfo.subTitle: Jon Christopher Brown oral history interview, 2000

name.description: Jon Christopher Brown was born on December 3, 1949, in Jersey City, N.J. He earned a B.S. degree in botany at the University of Massachusetts-Boston, an M.S. degree in botany at the University of Massachusetts-Amherst, and a Ph.D. in biology at Tulane University, where he wrote his dissertation on plant communities of the Calakmul Biosphere Reserve in Campeche, Mexico. A tobacco enthusiast, Brown became interested in Louisiana perique tobacco and has helped revive this dying crop through promotion and entrepreneurship with perique farmer, Percy Martin.

mods.abstract: Brown discusses his family and education, his interest in perique tobacco, and his efforts to help Percy Martin, the last full-time perique farmer, to market his product and expand his sales. He describes the history of perique, the production of specialty tobacco, and its positioning in the world market.
